mesh4d.regist.reg_cpd.Trans_Nonrigid_CPD#

class mesh4d.regist.reg_cpd.Trans_Nonrigid_CPD(source_obj: None | Type[Obj3d] = None, target_obj: None | Type[Obj3d] = None, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Trans_Nonrigid

Derived from mesh4d.field.Trans_Nonrigid and replace the displacement field estimation as Coherent Point Drift (CPD) based approach.

__init__(source_obj: None | Type[Obj3d] = None, target_obj: None | Type[Obj3d] = None, **kwargs)#

Methods

__init__([source_obj, target_obj])

add_to_scene(scene[, location])

Add the visualisation of current object to a pyvista.Plotter scene.

invert()

Return the inverted non-rigid transformation.

parse(tf_param, source_pcd)

Parse the registration result to provide self.source_points, self.deform_points, and self.disp.

regist([sample_num])

The registration method.

shift_kps(kps, **kwargs)

Implement the transformation to the key points object.

shift_mesh(mesh, **kwargs)

Implement the transformation to the mesh object.

shift_points(points[, k_nbr])

Implement the transformation to set of points.

show()

Illustrate the estimated transformation.
regist(sample_num: int = 1000, **kwargs)[source]#

The registration method.

Parameters:

  • sample_num –

    the number of the points sampled from the mesh to construct the point cloud.

    Attention

    Since the Coherent Point Drift (CPD) is not very efficient, the number of the sampling points used to estimate the displacement field should relatively small. The default value is 3000.

  • **kwargs – Configurations parameters of the registration.

See also

probreg.cpd.registration_cpd

parse(tf_param, source_pcd: PointCloud)[source]#

Parse the registration result to provide self.source_points, self.deform_points, and self.disp. Called by regist().

Parameters:

  • tf_param –

    Attention

    At current stage, the default registration method is Coherent Point Drift (CPD) method realised by probreg package. Therefore the accepted transformation object to be parse is derived from cpd.CoherentPointDrift. Transformation object provided by other registration method shall be tested in future development.

  • source_pcd – open3d point cloud object sampled from the source mesh.
